message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.HC 

This paper discusses the use of digital access records to recommend related papers in digital libraries. The primary focus is on information retrieval (IR) and digital libraries (DL), which suggests cs.DL and cs.IR as likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions co-access and co-citation measures, which are commonly used in citation analysis and bibliometrics, indicating that cs.CR (computational complexity and cryptography) may also be a relevant sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the accuracy and timeliness of the measures, which are important considerations in human-computer interaction (HCI) and social informatics (SI), suggesting cs.SI and cs.HC as possible sub-categories.
